novel.title: The Wheel of Meat
novel.author: Jeffrey [LAST NAME]
novel.genre: Literary Fiction / Speculative Fiction / Buddhist Fantasy
novel.logline: Across sixteen lifetimes spanning 300,000 years, a soul works toward enlightenment while a rival bodhisattva grows powerful enough to stop him—until they discover they were always two halves of the same future Buddha.
novel.structure_note: 26 chapters in 4 acts. Act II alternates between Silas's historical past lives and Lilith's contemporary pursuit, creating parallel forward momentum in both timelines.

acts.title: The Wheel Turns
acts.description: Ten historical past lives alternating with ten contemporary Lilith chapters. Silas develops perfections while Lilith's powers grow and her pursuit intensifies over a decade.

acts.title: The Breakthrough
acts.description: Return to contemporary Manchester; Silas achieves stream-entry; Lilith's realization of her error and turn toward unity

acts.title: The Ascension
acts.description: Post-stream-entry progression through higher realms; the race to Buddhahood; final merger into Maitreya

chapters.title: The Philosopher

setting.historical_context: Plague of Athens during Pericles' leadership

avatar.name: Philon of Kephissia
recognition_markers: Physical hesitation before touch (echo of Ka's deliberation)
Tendency to see individuals rather than categories
avatar.fatal_flaw: Conflates selflessness with self-destruction; cannot distinguish between compassionate service and martyrdom
avatar.binding_memory: As young man, witnessed physician refuse plague victim during earlier outbreak; victim died begging; vowed never to be the man who abandons

lilith.powers: Dream influence—can plant suggestions and emotional residue during sleep

intervention_1.method: Accelerates rumor that plague came from Persian ships
intervention_1.effect: Creates xenophobic panic; refugees flood to Philon; strains resources

intervention_2.method: Sends dream to Alexios: vision of Philon's corpse, certainty that following means death, whisper that survival is service
intervention_2.effect: Alexios refuses to help treat slave woman; Philon faces final choice alone

lilith.objective: Isolate Philon and accelerate his martyrdom by removing witnesses and support

alexios.function: Voices the lesson Philon cannot hear: survival enables service to many
alexios.arc: Believes in Philon's ethic until plague tests it; breaks when asked to accompany to slave woman; departure is rational, not cowardly
alexios.departure_argument: If we both die treating one slave, who treats the hundred waiting outside? You taught me that a physician's life belongs to his patients. All of them. Not just the one in front of us.

the_patient.name: TBD (foreign name or Greek slave-name)
the_patient.status: Abandoned by wealthy owners when symptomatic
the_patient.function: Lowest social status—makes Philon's choice maximally stark; echoes binding memory through her resignation
the_patient.death: Dies in Philon's arms in Third Episode despite his care

lesson.theme: Individual vs. collective good; distinguishing true altruism from self-destruction
lesson.core_development: Cannot see that martyrdom for one person abandons the many who need him; wisdom requires understanding context and consequences, not just immediate compassion
lesson.insight_achieved: Incomplete—arises in delirium: 'If I had lived, I could have saved a hundred. I chose one. Was the one for them—or for me?'
lesson.karmic_seed: There must be a way to understand virtue correctly → becomes Stoic investigator's obsession with moral framework

backfire.actual_result: By ensuring Philon faces choice entirely alone (no one to share burden/blame), his death becomes concentrated seed of insight rather than diluted tragedy; karmic weight pure and undiffused

chapters.title: The Investigator

setting.historical_context: Roman legal system, patronage culture, philosophical schools

avatar.name: Verinus (Lucius Severian Verinus)
avatar.occupation: Legal investigator attached to the praetor urbanus
recognition_markers: Physical ritual: compulsively cleans bronze stylus when testimony contradicts itself
Sees individuals rather than categories, even as he judges them harshly
avatar.fatal_flaw: Ill will expressed as resentment toward ambiguity, imperfection, and human inconsistency. Believes virtue requires errorless conclusions.
avatar.binding_pattern: Inherited martyrdom impulse transforms into rigid demand for moral and factual purity

lilith.identity: Marcia Faenia—quiet young woman, dark-haired, observational stillness
lilith.powers: Circumstance manipulation—can subtly manipulate circumstances and minor characters

cameo.method: Silent observation at Stoic debate; establishes physical characteristics
cameo.effect: Non-interference; seeds her Chapter 9 awareness of growing powers

intervention_1.method: Clerk miscopies crucial line from testimonial scroll (Lilith-induced distraction)
intervention_1.effect: Creates two competing versions of same statement; seeds cognitive fracture

intervention_2.method: Triggers noisy argument elsewhere that stalls traffic
intervention_2.effect: Witness arrives late, shifting timeline and making alibi impossible; forces Verinus to choose what to believe

intervention_3.method: Amplifies senator's temper from displeasure into rage
intervention_3.effect: Verinus sentenced to relegatio (exile); intended to break him through meaninglessness

lilith.objective: Two mini interferences funnel into major one. If destabilized by ambiguity, Verinus should compromise—sacrifice servant to preserve position. Man who can't trust evidence should trust power.

marcus_cassianus_priscus.function: Represents emotional truth and human connection Verinus refuses to embrace
marcus_cassianus_priscus.arc: Tries to follow Verinus into exile but blocked by political appointment to Brundisium
marcus_cassianus_priscus.key_trait: Laughs at contradictions; sees emotional truth where Verinus sees logical disorder
marcus_cassianus_priscus.final_action: Sends letter to Verinus in exile with news of servant's rebuilt life

gaius_quintilius_varro.function: Creates naturally paradoxical mystery that resists rational reconstruction

the_servant.function: Legally guilty but morally innocent—terrified man who omitted detail
the_servant.arc: After Verinus's exile, attempts to intercede to help Marcus; later rebuilds modest life (vegetable stall, wife with child)

the_senator.function: Expects verdict protecting his dignity by condemning servant
the_senator.action: Rage (Lilith-amplified) leads to Verinus's exile; blocks Marcus with political appointment

lesson.theme: Ethical action in morally ambiguous situations; virtue independent of certainty
lesson.core_development: Cannot distinguish between certainty and virtue; resentment toward ambiguity disguised as Stoic detachment
lesson.insight_achieved: Virtue is action taken within uncertainty, not purity achieved through perfect knowledge. Compassion is not opposite of reason but its completion.
lesson.karmic_seed: Accepting uncertainty and choosing compassion softens heart, making him vulnerable to next fetter: sensual desire and emotional attachment → seeds Heian Japan life

backfire.lilith_intention: Exile meant to break Verinus—strand him in meaninglessness, man whose life's work was coherence now marooned in chaos
backfire.actual_result: Accumulated contradictions haven't made him cynical—they've made him humble. Realizes he cannot know with certainty but can still choose with compassion. Protects servant despite uncertainty. Exile removes him from Rome's certainty-obsessed culture, creating space for transformation. Senator meant to destroy him; instead freed him.
backfire.mechanism: By ensuring Verinus faces choice entirely alone and then exiling him to silence, Lilith inadvertently gives him permission to not know—the one thing Rome never could

scenes.title: The Assignment
scenes.function: Establish Jean's world, professional identity as neutral investigator, and impossible assignment that will break that identity
scenes.action: Jean receives assignment from Magistrate de Lacaze: Protestant notable Henri de Ségur murdered on road; Catholics blamed, but whispers suggest Protestant hardliners eliminating moderate; peace depends on right finding
scenes.doubt_work: Jean understands immediately: being asked to find politically useful truth; professional neutrality already under siege
scenes.genre_obligation: Mission briefing convention; establish stakes and ticking clock

scenes.title: The Witnesses
scenes.function: First encounter with irreconcilable testimony; gathering information becomes epistemological trap
scenes.action: Jean interviews witnesses at inn and Protestant household: Catholic merchant saw Protestant riders fleeing; Protestant farmer saw Catholic soldiers lurking; servant heard victim arguing with own faction; accounts internally coherent but mutually exclusive
scenes.doubt_work: Jean's professional tools—compare, cross-reference, find inconsistencies—reveal inconsistency without resolving it; method produces questions, not answers
scenes.genre_obligation: Investigation as motion; different locations, voices, rising tension

scenes.title: The Ambush
scenes.function: First major action set-piece; violence clarifies that neutrality is not safety
scenes.action: Jean attacked on wooded road by masked men, faction unclear; desperate close fight; old shoulder wound screams; kills one, wounds another, escapes into woods as rest break off
scenes.doubt_work: Binding wound alone: Who sent them? Catholic elimination or Protestant silencing? Cannot know. But knows: both sides watching, both will act
scenes.genre_obligation: Mandatory ambush; proves stakes are lethal; bloods the protagonist

scenes.title: The Printer's Widow
scenes.function: Introduce Lilith's vessel; establish philosophical companionship that will become temptation
scenes.action: Jean seeks Marguerite Viret at her print shop for documents—correspondence, intellectual underground connections; caution becomes interest; discussion slides into philosophy: limits of testimony, impossibility of certainty, what one can honestly claim to know
scenes.doubt_work: Marguerite articulates Jean's doubts more clearly than he can; quotes skeptics—'Que sais-je?'; suggests honest uncertainty might be more virtuous than false conviction; Jean feels understood (dangerous)
scenes.genre_obligation: The ally who may be more; intellectual tension as romantic possibility; information exchange
scenes.recognition_moment: As Jean leaves, glimpses Marguerite watching from upper window—stillness seems older than her face; he shakes off impression

scenes.title: The Document
scenes.function: Central evidentiary crisis; letter that could resolve everything or damn everyone
scenes.action: Among Marguerite's documents, Jean finds letter suggesting killing was internal—Protestant faction eliminating moderate; if authentic, exonerates Catholics and indicts Protestant leadership; but provenance uncertain, could be forged, cannot verify; Captain de Castelnau summons Jean for progress report—Jean reveals nothing about letter; Captain's courtesy has edge
scenes.doubt_work: Letter crystallizes the fetter: cannot know if real; any action (include/exclude) could be wrong; honest move seems to be: wait, investigate, suspend judgment
scenes.genre_obligation: MacGuffin document; faction pressure personified; rising stakes

scenes.title: The Ball
scenes.function: Social combat set-piece; rhetoric as fencing; every conversation is trap
scenes.action: Jean attends nobleman's ball where investigation is subtext of every exchange; Father Sorbin corners with elegant questions that are threats; Captain's lieutenant asks pointed timeline questions; Catholic lady implies knowledge of ambush—warning or test?; Jean navigates with neutral answers, reveals nothing, commits to nothing
scenes.doubt_work: Realizes silence being read as alliance by both sides; each faction assumes he's secretly with them; neutrality producing false certainty in others; sees his own strategy reflected/distorted—they all use ambiguity as weapon
scenes.genre_obligation: Mandatory ball scene; verbal fencing; social stakes as lethal as swords

scenes.title: The Temptation
scenes.function: Lilith's intervention reaches peak; nihilist argument laid bare
scenes.action: Jean returns to Marguerite late at night with crisis: the letter, irreconcilable witnesses, impossibility of conclusion; she listens, then articulates what he fears: 'If you cannot verify, you cannot include. If you cannot resolve contradiction, you cannot conclude. Only honest report is no report. Perhaps honest uncertainty means refusing to participate in their game of false certainties.'
scenes.doubt_work: Vicikicchā in pure form: I cannot know, therefore I cannot act; philosophical justification for spiritual paralysis; argument is clean, matches everything Jean believes; he almost agrees
scenes.genre_obligation: Dark night of soul; temptation scene; ally revealing as tempter

scenes.title: The Report
scenes.function: The breakthrough; Jean discovers truthfulness doesn't require certainty
scenes.action: Jean sits with notes; deadline tomorrow; de Lacaze made clear: submit or be dismissed; writes not what factions want or demand—writes what he observed, what he could not verify, that witness testimony is irreconcilable without unobtainable evidence, that letter's authenticity is unverifiable and should not be relied upon, that he has no conclusion—only truthful account of what investigation found and failed to find; submits to de Lacaze; magistrate's face: this protects no one, satisfies no one, will be seen as betrayal by everyone
scenes.doubt_work: The conversion: Jean discovers he can act *as someone who does not know*—stating honestly what was observed and what remains uncertain—rather than refusing to act because he does not know; truthfulness is not certainty but honest acknowledgment of limits combined with willingness to face consequences
scenes.genre_obligation: Turning point; hero commits; no retreat possible

scenes.title: The Road
scenes.function: Death scene; Jean dies for honest uncertainty; soul burns forward
scenes.action: Jean leaves Bordeaux knowing he cannot stay—both factions will move against him; perhaps can reach another jurisdiction, another life; doesn't make it; Captain de Castelnau's men find him, or Father Sorbin's, or both working together—factions united only in need to punish man who refused useful certainty; fight is brief; shoulder betrays him; goes down
scenes.doubt_work: Dying in dirt, thinks: I told truth about what I didn't know. That was mine to give. It wasn't enough. But it was true. Question burns forward: *If I can die for honest uncertainty, what can I die for with conviction? What deserves that certainty I refused to fake?* Hunger for that answer pulls forward—century, two centuries ahead, cause worth dying for, commitment that doesn't require pretending to know, choice made with eyes open
scenes.genre_obligation: Death with dignity; no rescue; meaning in the end
scenes.karmic_bridge: Lesson completes—vicikicchā broken not by acquiring certainty but by acting truthfully without it; lesson incomplete—Jean acted under uncertainty but never found what deserved certain commitment; seeds Taiping rebel

death_bridge.description: Dies during July 19, 1864 Qing massacre of Tianjing. Organizes evacuation knowing it will fail (Lilith intercepts it). Stays with wounded who cannot flee. Killed by Qing soldiers while protecting them.
